caption: WAR-WEARY Ukrainian troops in Vuhledar, on the eastern front line, where they are outmanned, outgunned and digging in. Page A6.
image_1.context: KYIV, Ukraine — President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that a broad overhaul of the country’s military and civilian leadership was needed to reboot the war effort against Russia, suggesting that a major shake-up of his government was imminent. Mr. Zelensky’s comments, in a broadcast on Sunday night, indicated that his plans would likely go beyond replacing the top military commander, Gen. Valeriy Zaluzhny. And they signaled a search for a new strategy among Ukraine’s leadership at a precarious moment, with depleted Ukrainian forces on the By MARC SANTORA and ANDREW E. KRAMER Zelensky Plans A Major ‘Reset’ In Leadership VOL. CLXXIII . . . . No. 60,056 © 2024 The New York Times Company TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 6, 2024
image_1.description: The image depicts a war-torn scene in Vuhledar, on the eastern front line of Ukraine. Three Ukrainian soldiers are walking across a desolate area covered with patches of snow and debris. They are dressed in camouflage uniforms and tactical gear, including helmets and backpacks. The background shows a severely damaged multi-story building with numerous windows blown out and structural damage evident. The atmosphere is bleak and somber, reflecting the harsh conditions faced by the troops. The ground is littered with rubble and remnants of destruction, indicating recent conflict. The soldiers appear to be moving cautiously through the area, possibly assessing the situation or preparing for further action.

image_2.context: Behind these risks are two powerful forces: Climate change, which can intensify both rain and drought, and the natural weather Two far-flung corners of the world, known for temperate climates, are buffeted by deadly disasters. Wildfires have killed more than 120 people as they swept the forested hillsides of Chile, and record-breaking rains have swelled rivers and led to mudslides in Southern California. By SOMINI SENGUPTA Disparate Disasters in Chile and California Have the Same Culprit Uneasy About Economy? Nevada Gets It. A sense of insecurity is especially palpable in a state so dependent on the tourism industry. Page B1. inhabit the role of an incumbent president, including by putting the typical trappings of a postpresidency to use in trying to reclaim the office.  At a minimum, that approach may have helped to soothe Mr. Trump’s bruised ego. But it has indisputably become a crucial factor in his effort to return to power. A majority of Republican voters, polls show, view Mr. Trump not as a “defeated former president,” as President Biden often calls him, but as a wrongly deposed president whose re-election would amend a grave injustice. Elected Republicans who once privately mocked the conspiracy Continued on Page A11
image_2.description: The image depicts a bustling urban scene at dusk or early evening. In the foreground, there is a double-decker bus with passengers visible through the windows. The bus has a sign indicating a fare of $6 for 2 hours. The upper deck is partially filled with people, some of whom are looking out the windows. The lower deck is less visible but appears to have a few passengers as well. The bus is in front of a large building with the name 'The Mirage' prominently displayed in bright lights. The building features a large advertisement for the Beatles LOVE show by Cirque du Soleil. The sky is darkening, suggesting it is either dusk or early evening. Palm trees are visible in the background, adding to the tropical ambiance of the scene. The overall atmosphere is lively and dynamic, typical of a busy city street near a popular tourist destination.

But the final blow was delivered by Siemens, a giant German corporation that had swept into town in 2010, boldly promising to install modern water meters that would boost revenue and return Jackson’s water system to a moneymaking enterprise that could afford to fix its crumbling infrastructure. ContinuedonPageA14  their toilets, some parents sent their children into the woods to relieve themselves. Businesses closed. Mississippi’s capital effectively shut down. The next year, at the height of Mississippi’s sweltering summer in August 2022, it all happened again. Each time Jackson faced a water crisis, local and state leaders cast blame in familiar directions. Lawmakers criticized city officials for ignoring leaky pipes and failing to collect payments from customers. City officials pointed to Jackson’s shrinking population and decades of economic decline. And they said state officials, mostly white and Republican, had Defunct water meters at a facility in Moss Point, Miss.
image_3.description: The image depicts a pile of defunct water meters scattered on the ground. The meters are of various sizes and shapes, predominantly blue and yellow in color. Some meters have visible damage, with parts missing or broken. The background appears to be a concrete surface, suggesting an industrial or storage setting. The meters are interconnected with wires and pipes, indicating they were once part of a larger system. The overall scene conveys a sense of disuse and abandonment, highlighting the failure of infrastructure. The caption indicates that these are defunct water meters from Moss Point, Mississippi, which aligns with the context provided about water crises and infrastructure issues in the region.

image_4.description: The image shows an elderly man with white hair and a friendly expression, waving his right hand in greeting. He is dressed in a dark blue suit with a light blue shirt and a patterned tie. The background appears to be indoors, possibly in a formal setting, with wooden paneling and a painting or framed artwork on the wall. The man's posture is upright, and he seems to be engaging with someone or addressing an audience. The overall atmosphere conveyed by the image is one of warmth and approachability.

image_5.description: The image depicts a person with long, curly hair wearing a form-fitting, sheer dress with a pattern that appears to be of a digital or pixelated nature. The individual is in motion, possibly dancing or walking energetically, as suggested by the dynamic posture and the position of the arms and legs. The person is holding a smartphone in one hand, which displays a colorful screen, possibly indicating an app or game. The background is abstract with soft, pastel colors, primarily pink and white, giving the scene a dreamy and surreal atmosphere. The overall mood conveyed by the image is one of joy and movement, with a modern, digital aesthetic.

image_6.description: The image depicts a green parakeet being held by a person's hand. The bird appears to be receiving a dose of CBD oil, which is being administered directly into its mouth using a dropper. The parakeet has bright green feathers with a lighter shade around the eyes and a small patch of yellow on its face. Its eyes are wide open, and it seems to be looking up at the dropper. The person holding the bird has neatly trimmed nails and is wearing a white sleeve, suggesting a clinical or veterinary setting. The background is blurred but appears to be an indoor environment, possibly a veterinary clinic. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of care and medical treatment.
